newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine court blocks tax prosecution of tycoon.
newsitem.headline: Philippine court blocks tax prosecution of tycoon.

text.p: The Philippine Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a government petition seeking to prosecute tobacco tycoon Lucio Tan on charges of evading 25.6 billion pesos ($1.0 billion) in taxes.
It was the second time the government had lost a bid to pursue the case against Tan for offences allegedly committed between 1990 and 1992.

In June last year, a five-member division of the Supreme Court blocked the government from prosecuting Tan saying that the government's tax collection agency had failed to make a detailed assessment of his liabilities.
On Thursday, the full 15-judge bench said in a unanimous ruling that there was no substantial argument to support a government petition to reconsider the earlier decision.
It also ordered that preliminary investigations of Tan and his Fortune Tobacco Co for suspected tax violations be started afresh.
Tan controls Fortune Tobacco and Asia Brewery and Allied Banking Corp. He is also chairman and chief executive officer of national carrier Philippine Airlines.
